title: Sync Catalogs Response
description: Response from catalog sync operation. Returns either per-catalog results (best-effort processing) OR operation-level errors (complete failure). Platforms may approve, reject, or flag individual items within each catalog (similar to Google Merchant Center product review).

oneOf.title: SyncCatalogsSuccess
oneOf.description: Success response - sync operation processed catalogs (may include per-catalog failures)

dry_run.description: Whether this was a dry run (no actual changes made)

catalogs.description: Results for each catalog processed. Items with action='failed' indicate per-catalog validation/processing failures, not operation-level failures.

platform_id.description: Platform-specific ID assigned to the catalog

item_count.description: Total number of items in the catalog after sync

items_approved.description: Number of items approved by the platform. Populated when the platform performs item-level review.

items_pending.description: Number of items pending platform review. Common for product catalogs where items must pass content policy checks.

items_rejected.description: Number of items rejected by the platform. Check item_issues for rejection reasons.

item_issues.description: Per-item issues reported by the platform (rejections, warnings). Only present when the platform performs item-level review.

item_id.description: ID of the catalog item with an issue

last_synced_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the most recent sync was accepted by the platform

next_fetch_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the platform will next fetch the feed URL. Only present for URL-based catalogs with update_frequency.

changes.description: Field names that were modified (only present when action='updated')

errors.description: Validation or processing errors (only present when action='failed')

sandbox.description: When true, this response contains simulated data from sandbox mode.

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

oneOf.title: SyncCatalogsError
oneOf.description: Error response - operation failed completely, no catalogs were processed

errors.description: Operation-level errors that prevented processing any catalogs (e.g., authentication failure, service unavailable, invalid request format)

items.title: Error
items.description: Standard error structure for task-specific errors and warnings

field.description: Field path associated with the error (e.g., 'packages[0].targeting')

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying the operation
